result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jean M Schmitt was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond of $500.00 applied to the fine and court costs.

- Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: To commence immediately. Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  Huber to be for work and counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
1:41 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to OWI-5th offense with probation and all other counts will be dismissed.  State concurs and states also conditional jail time.  Atty Johnson concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed outright and orders 2016TR1139 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

- Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-6 months county jail.  Court grants huber for work and counseling, out of county service and out of county travel.
-$600 fine plus court costs.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 3 years
-IID - 3 years
-AODA (marquette)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 1:57 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

2:37 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on February 14, 2017 at1:30 P.M.

Court adjourned at 2:38 p.m.
Status hearing on December 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

1:58 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - defendant is in treatment and believes this matter will resolve.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 13, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:00 p.m.
Status hearing on November 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:48 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Erik Johnson present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - counsel provided Discovery prior to court.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 1, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  Court allows Attorney Johnson to appear on behalf of the defendant.

Court adjourned at 2:48 p.m.
State's
Status hearing on September 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

10:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Johnson and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Johnson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on September 13, 2016 at 2:30 P.M.

Court adjourned at 10:14 a.m.

10:15 a.m.  Statement by Atty Johnson in regards to the PAC citation.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Matter to track with the criminal case.
Status hearing on August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

43
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.

1:09 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court questions defendant regarding employment and address.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 21, 2016 at 9:50 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:13 p.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
